Reviews.Title: “Definitely the chosen one for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Carla_Thiago
Reviews.Content: A very comfy and romantic hotel. Great value. Having delicious breakfast at the roof garden was a must every morning. A stone's throw from the Lepanto metro station. From the hotel priviledged location we were able to walk to both the centre of Rome and the Vatican city in less than 20 minutes. Very friendly staff with great advice for places to eat nearby, such as San Marco's and Il Villini's trattorias. As we were travelling by car, one of our concerns was a place to park it. The hotel offers a private area for guests to safely leave our cars during the whole stay, if necessary. Needless to say, we did not use the car during our 4-day trip to Rome, we were visiting every place on foot or by metro, during the day or at night. It is worth the 4 (and an extra half!) stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Visitors from Finland”
Reviews.Author: Soile K
Reviews.Content: Huge and nice room. Breakfast on the 5th floor terrace with nice views. Very close to the metro station. Friendly staff :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend at Hotel Farnese”
Reviews.Author: Hmswab
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weekend nights with my partner in March 2012. We chose to stay in one of the 3 below-ground floor rooms. We arrived at 12:30pm (an hour and a half before check-in time) expecting a wait. We were happy to discover our room was ready and were shown to it straight away. The room was huge, as was the bathroom. It was decorated nicely throughout, and in particular I loved the painted ceiling. The bed was massive and comfortable, and there was plenty of storage space. Our requests were met promptly (extra towels) and the room was made up every morning to a high degree. The staff were pleasant and accommodating. The breakfast was also nice, with an array of continental breakfast choices; pastry, bacon, eggs, cereals, breads, meats and cheese, and fruits. Cappucino was made upon request and was lovely, as was the fresh-squeezed blood orange juice. The roof terrace had a nice atmosphere and the view was nice. We also discovered (upon checking out, sadly) that the front desk sells metro tickets! The Lepanto metro station is just a stone's throw from the hotel (you can actually see it from the hotel) so it's very convenient! The location of this hotel is perfect; it's in a quiet neighborhood filled with cafes, restaurants, shops, etc. and it felt safe even at night, and was near enough to all the major attractions, certainly within walking distance. We would stay again, great value (internet rate of €75/night). Be sure to also visit Gelateria dei Gracchi nearby for some delicious gelato!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: traveler2sons
Reviews.Content: We were 3 single females in spacious a triple room with an equally spacious bathroom. the hotel was immaculate and the personnel friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the breakfast on the 5th floor terrace with great views. The hotel is close to the Metro and bus stops. Nearby restaurants served delicious food, especially "Da Vito E Dina" Hosteria Pizzeria. Look for the review elsewhere in Trip Advisor. We would definitely come back to Hotel Farnese.

Reviews.Title: “Some hotels just are better - Farnese is one of these”
Reviews.Author: Lari-Pekka
Reviews.Content: Hotel Farnese's location is great, breakfast and (superior) rooms are outstanding. Reception's multilingual, polite and professional personal full filled all our needs. We were very very pleased. Next time no doubt about it, where we're going to have our accommodation. Thank You! :) :)

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita”
Reviews.Author: charles m
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in early September 2011. Weather was very hot, therefore, the most impressive feature of this hotel was the individually controlled thermostat in the room. The air conditioning was superb. The same superlative applies to the rest of the hotel's services and amenities. The rooftop breakfast was a great start to each day. The food is fresh, the cappuccino made to order and the view terrific. The young Romanian hostess is delightful and she runs a spotless operation. Squezzing your own fresh orange juice is a plus. Room is large with high ceiling. Plenty of closet and storage. King size bed made out of two beds, but turns out not to be very noticeable. Linens and pillows are comfortable. The bathroom is large and well lighted. Large tub with shower head. Room was cleaned and bed made daily. The staff (especially Andreas) were very helpful and made our trip even more memorable. One block from the Lepanto metro stop and Via M Colonna bus stops and taxi stand make city travel much easier. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sieramail
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay in hotel Farnese made our recent trip to Rome even more memorable. It perfectly meeted our requirements: elegant, clean and cosy, away from hustle and bustle of the old town, yet a walking distance to Piazza del Popolo and Vatican. Metro station just a few hundred meters away as well as buses which saved our legs a walk to the downtown. In the neighbourhood we found some good places to eat (try Il Ciociaro for roman cuisine or Mondo Arancina for Sicilian snacks) and do some shopping on Cola di Rienzo avenue. As for hotel itself, our room overlooked the backyard, so it wasn't noisy at all and we had a good sleep on the huge comfortable bed. Marble bathroom gave a final elegant touch to the room. It would be sinnful not to mention the breakfast room which is located an the terasse. We were looking forward to our breakfast each morning to enjoy a cup of real Italian cappuccino and freshly squeezd juice while admiring beautiful panorama. Cannot find a better start of the day. Breakfast table was rich, with home made honey, fresh red oranges, croissants, cookies and pie, not forgetting scrambled eggs and variety of hams. It was an excellent choice for a reasonable price, and I would lively recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, we will come back!”
Reviews.Author: PerArneSkjelvik
Reviews.Content: We had 4 wonderful days in Rome, and this hotel was absolutely a part of it. The staff is extremely serviceoriented, and the room was prepared twice a day! All the rooms are different, and breakfast is delicious. We will absolutely recomend - and come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, wondrful staff, three stops away from Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Antthetraveller
Reviews.Content: My stay at Farnese was one of my favorite hotel experiences EVER, and I would hands-down recommend it to anyone coming to Rome. The prices are a fantastic deal, considering the location, the decor, the quality of the service, and the included breakfast. Hotel Farnese is a beautifully decorated hotel with lots of small details that add a special touch to your Rome trip. The staff are all exceptionally kind and pleasant and help make your experience as personally tailored as possible. All in all, it is clear that the hotel has some great management and knows how to stand out. One recommendation for the staff - consider recommending better tour options to your clients. Going with the watered down Green Tours reflects badly on the type of quality service you are trying to provide. There are plenty of better quality tours available to your customers within Rome. Consider establishing relationships with some of these smaller tour companies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice..”
Reviews.Author: CLangcake
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor, beautiful rooms and The morning breakfast room is a beautiful beautiful enclosed roof-top terrrace with panaromic view add up with great choice of food & fresh juice. Exceptional homely service by Alessandra & Gabrielle; willing to spend time offering advice on giving directions, making booking for tours, suggestion on choice of restaurant. It is one of the best hotel during our honeymoon trip in Oct/Nov 2011. We'll definitely go back. Mr. & Mrs. Langcake

Reviews.Title: “Great hideaway!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_KY
Reviews.Content: Overall: Loved this small botique hotel. Lovely decor, plentiful breakfast, great staff. Would definitely return. Location: VERY GOOD - Literally 1/2 a block from the Lepanto subway stop. Hotel is situated in a neighborhood, and we were out until 10pm and felt safe. A little far to walk to the Spanish Steps or the Colessium, but both are easily accessible by the subway. Room: We had a basement room and were surprised at how nice the decor was. The ceilings were painted, there was an alcove to store luggage, and the bathroom was not cramped (although typical European shower stall). Very nicely decorated and painted - we felt the most italian feeling of the 4 hotels we stayed in. Breakfast: The freshly squeezed orange juice was literally the best I've ever had - truly delicious, I had several glasses each morning. Breakfast is served on the rooftop and offers cereal, crossaints, scrambled eggs, yogurt, breakfast pies / tarts, etc. Service: The staff was amazing - always happy to answer questions and provide advice. We flew out of Rome and didn't want to deal with public transportation -they booked a private car for us which we thought was very reasonable at $50 Euros considering FCO was probably 40 minutes away. Highly recommend this hotel without reservation - you receive personal service, great breakfast, and a nicely appointed room in a botique hotel / oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: MBrown123123
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful, bathrooms were very large, everything was spotless. The staff was also very helpful (Alessandra & Gabriella especially), willing to spend time offering advice, ordering cabs when needed, making reservations at restaurants. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nono190
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel--the service at the front desk is outstanding, and a real old world feel about it. We chose it because we wanted to be outside of the historic center noise and crowds, and it is in a lovely residential Roman neighborhood with lots of great restaurants and very easy bus/subway access. That being said, it sometimes felt like a hassle to make our way to a sight or to get home from one. Once home, though, you feel very nurtured and relaxed. A good choice if you have a longer stay, like 4-5 days. A short flight of steep steps to get in to the lobby, be forewarned. Great rooftop terrace breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel With Gracious Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Farnese for 9 nights (Oct. 14th- 23rd) and it was just perfect. The hotel is small and in a lovely neighborhood. The rooms were comfortable, and our room had a balcony which made for some late evenings drinking wine and star gazing. The best part about the hotel though was the wonderful staff (Andreas, Alexandria, Louie, and Graciela) They were very friendly and seemed to have a geniune concern for our stay. Any request that we had, was taken care of. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: We loved our four night stay at Hotel Farnese while in Rome for our honeymoon! The breakfast each day was a great start to the day, with cappuccinos and hot chocolates being made by request. The location worked really well, very close to the metro and close walking distance to the Vatican. We were also able to easily walk to Ancient Rome and the Spanish steps, about a 20 minute walk. Our room had a beautiful sunporch that opened from both the bedroom and the bathroom, we loved this for drinking wine at night and eating pizza we had purchased around the corner! The hotel reception is also helpful, as they are able to allow you to exchange money and purchase metro tickets at the front desk. They exchanged our US Dollars to Euros for less than exchanging at the bank had been. Thank you for a wonderful visit Farnese, we hope to visit again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1944_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in Sep at the start of our Italian trip. Friends had recommended it, we probably would not have found it on our own. We stayed in room #41. As my husband was ill, this room worked reallywell, the small private terrace let us come back after sightseeing and put our feet up, have a glass of wine, and relax in privacy. The bathroom is terrific..large with a wonderful shower. The buffet breakfast was the best we had on our entire trip. The front desk is always helpful. Location in the Vatican area allowed to walk there within minutes. A metro stop is just around the corner. A great beginning for us..

Reviews.Title: “Great little Boutique Hotel in nice, quiet Rome neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JenKevChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights (17/9 to 20/9) as a part of our Italian honeymoon and had a fabulous time! We stayed in Room #41--a very nice, cute room with a nice, private balcony/terrace. The room was sufficient in size (CNN and BBC on the TV, too), the bathroom very manageable (with a nice enclosed shower with multiple sprays) and the terrace had several chairs and a table with umbrella. Our room terrace was perfect for capping our evenings with a bottle of wine or Prosecco, for lounging around in our robes and for enjoying and planning our next day of activities! We were welcomed nicely with a bottle of Prosecco upon our arrival and Louis and other hotel staff were more than accomodating with everything! Additionally, the hotel offered a spectacular breakfast each morning on its beautiful rooftop terrace. The breakfast was a very nice spread of fresh fruit, meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, fresh squeezed orange juice, and baked apples (which I really loved!). Additionally, the terrace offers a great view of the domes of St. Peter's and gives you a great beginning to your day! My wife and I really loved the location of the hotel--we loved that it was a little off the beaten path, was situated in a quiet residential, non-tourist area, and it's location 1/2 a block from a Metro stop was really convenient. Also, it was a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Vatican and probably a 10 to 15 minute walk to Piazza del Popolo--also perfectly situated for us. It was an easy 15-20 minute taxi ride to the Train Station (Termini), and again, easily accessible to all the sights via Subway or taxi. We really found this boutique hotel (a former mansion) to be very cute, intimate, place to stay and loved all of the small little touches it offered. Also, the staff (especially Louis) was very nice and accomodating and helpful including making a cocktail for us to begin our evenings! Also when we had potential problems arriving from Naples (due to lost luggage) they were very helpful and understanding. We will definitely come back to Rome someday (probably with our mothers/other family members) and have already decided we will stay at Hotel Farnese when we come back! Thanks to the previous reviews for assisting me with booking this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Good Location TransTiber”
Reviews.Author: SalishSea101
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Farnese in Room 41 and found the hotel to be a very nice base for exploring Rome. Our room was comfortable, with the best bed of our trip; and the bathroom was large enough. The highlight of the accommodation, however, was a great little terrace that we used as much as we could as a place to relax, drink wine, plan our next day's adventures, drink wine, write postcards, drink wine... The terrace had a small table, two chairs, two basic loungers, an umbrella, and just enough greenery to create that sense of enclosure that you want. The breakfast was another highlight. This was a great breakfast spread, one of the nicest we had on the trip, with killer views of some of the domes of Rome, including St. Peter's. The location was quite good. It was only a few steps from the Lepanto Metro station, which allows for very easy access west toward St. Peter's and the Vatican Museums, or east towards Piazza del Popolo, Piazza di Spagna, etc. The Metro isn't perfect for sightseeing, as many of Rome's attractions are not really on the Metro line, but it's still handy to be close to a station. We reached the hotel by taxi from the Termini, and the cost was only 14 euros (it was a Sunday so traffic was lighter than other days). We thought this was very reasonable, given that we had to cross town and cross the Tiber. Drawbacks? A little out of the way of the major sights, perhaps, so might not be the best choice for first timers to Rome. It was perfect for us, however, since we had earlier stayed on Via Nazionale closer to the Trevi Fountain area, so this was a nice change and allowed us to explore the more 'Roman' area around Piazza del Popolo. The only other minor quibble is that on our second day we needed breakfast right at 7 am, but the breakfast service wasn't quite ready on time, which was a bit off-putting, but we still had a decent bite to eat before heading off to Fiumcino to catch our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and helpful stuff, far and a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Effi80
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several nights at the hotel, stuff were very welcoming and helpful, breakfast was nice up on the terrace, downside-location was a bit far for us, needed to take the metro/taxi several times. Also some traffic noise but probeblt better then centro .

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with charm close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: icehouse45
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming with very helpful people on the front desk. The room was very large with a couple of comfortable armchairs to sit in. The bathroom was very big and although the bath had the shower overhead it was quite okay. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was excellent and it was no trouble at all to have 2 cappuchinos.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: GreatTrip356
Reviews.Content: Lovely spot, easy to walk to the Vatican. We had six people in two rooms. Our 10 and 16 year old daughters loved the bunk bed. I've never seen this in a hotel before. Linens are high quality and the air conditioning works extremely well. It can actually get cold in the room if you are not careful. (This was not possible in any other hotel we stayed in in Italy.) We thought this neighborhood would be better than that around the train station. Hotel offered to send a van to transport us from the airport. This was an excellent idea. It almost cost the same as the train for the six of us and was infinitely more comfortable. If you stay here, try the Osteria Centouno, Via Fabio Massimo 101, tel: 06-3235790. It's an easy walk and was not at all "touristy" (which is very hard to find in Rome). It was not on the concierge's list of restaurants to try. Excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first two nights of our Italy road trip. We picked this hotel originally for the free parking, thinking that we'd pick our car up at the Rome FCO airport and do a preliminary driving tour around the Coliseum before checking in for two nights (didn't drive in Rome after we checked in!). It worked out beautifully. The room was beautiful, bathroom spacious, and the fifth floor rooftop restaurant lovely - it even had fresh-squeezed orange juice. The location was perfect for us - quiet as it was on the west side of the Tiber river (away from Tivoli Fountain area), but within walking distance of both the Vatican and Tivoli. Only warning for Italy hotels in general (that we stayed at anyway) is to pack in small to medium bags as the elevators are tiny and you often have to stack your bags to fit!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, would stay again given the opportunity”
Reviews.Author: Carannah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our 2nd week of travels/business in Rome for 6 nights. The service was very friendly (thanks especially to Andrea) and welcoming. The room was immaculate and very well furnished. Location was key - it's the absolute best location in Rome if your are planning a longer stay in here. It is well situated in a quiet residential neighbourhood, outside of the touristy historical center with easy access to all sites via metro. 15 mins walk to Vatican City, Piazza Navona, Piazza di Popolo. View during breakfast was tops it all off. Highly recommended. TIP: Shop where the locals shop: Via Cola di Rienzo (5 mins walk)

Reviews.Title: “Best staffs during our Europe trip”
Reviews.Author: Haru_san_11
Reviews.Content: The points for this hotel should go for the staffs, they were just so nice and helpful. The hotel room is small but it may be standard for Italian hotels. The location is next to Lepanto metro station Line A and easy to go everywhere. But since the metro stop working after 9pm so it is not suitable for those who wants to spend late night out at tourist spots unless he/she is willing to deal with Rome taxi tricks at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel I recommend”
Reviews.Author: Peter_L_MTL
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon trip to Italy this summer and even though its price was higher than the other choices we had, I booked it anyways based on the reviews. Excellent service, kind and relax. We had champagne, lots of roses and some chips at our arrival, which was perfect, the room was spacious with a real king bed, a balcony that was good to drink the champagne. The room deco was nice, it did give a very good romano-romantic atmosphere, whic we appreciated. The breakfast is fully equipped, and you can drink as many freshly squeezed orange juice and coffee as you wish. This hotel is near the vatican and the castle by foot (approx 10-20 min) and 1 min to the metro station - so you can get to each major attraction in Rome in more or less 10 to 20 minutes when taking the subway. And the Wi-Fi is free so for us that was perfect. Pierre L from MTL.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fullers4
Reviews.Content: My family thoroughly enjoyed this fabulous hotel. The rooms were beautiful and clean, the bathrooms very spacious and the rooftop breakfast possibly the best breakfast we had on our one-month trip through Europe...complete with Italian music and a view of the Vatican in the distance. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great!”
Reviews.Author: Susie1917
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 adult children and it was fantastic. The metro is close and most of the major attractions are a stop or two away. You can buy tickets at the desk (a little tip I found out while checking out.) The lobby is beautiful as is the terrace. The breakfast is sumptuous. There are plants everywhere! All of the staff is courteous, helpful, and personable. They will call you a taxi which is nice since in Rome one can't just go out to the street and hail one. Which is weird when you think of it since all traffic laws in Rome are merely suggestions. But, I digress. If they are available, book the rooms with balconies. It was sweet to spend a couple of jet-lagged hours at 2:00 a.m. sitting on the balcony with a beer!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Tradional place with very high service level”
Reviews.Author: anna232
Reviews.Content: Iwas here during a short business trip, lovely charming traditional place! The room was small, but comfortable with a romantic balcony, good airco, nice bed. Fast internet. but the most fantastic was the incredible staf. They made us feel special and had fantastic suggestions for restaurants, I am planning to return here for a romantic long weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Rob188632
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much because it was located in a quiet neighbourhood close to the touristic centre of Rome. Also the staff was very friendly and gave us some good advise about visiting the touristic sites. The room was well furnished in an antique Roman style wich gave us a real luxury Roman feeling. So this hotel made our first stay in Rome unforgettable !

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: fred33002
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet, friendly, and tasteful. I wanted a place that was more Roman than one might find in the touristy areas, and I was not disappointed. The subway and bus stops are very close. Walking to sites is doable but not always easy.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive luxury”
Reviews.Author: Toohot0
Reviews.Content: Very expensive but missing a few simple things, like a kettle and a desk in the room. Also missing a bar dowstairs, and they advised a bad open top bus tour. Otherwise, very close to the tube station, perfect service, perfect cleanliness, perfect room.

Reviews.Title: “Former villa turned excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieSheWrote
Reviews.Content: This gem of a small hotel located on a leafy street in the Prati section of Rome is off the beaten tourist track yet still well located enough to get you easily to all the attractions in Rome. The Metro is right on the corner and the hotel is only 3 short blocs from the Cola di Rienzo, the main shopping avenue of the district. The double room we had was well appointed with a clean, large bathroom. While the district is residential and quiet in the evening, the double paned windows allow you to sleep in quiet comfort when Rome wakes up in the morning. Breakfast is a delight on the 5th floor covered roof terrace garden room. It is a full breakfast buffet with a lovely attendant who will make you fresh squeezed orange juice and an excellent cappuccino to start your day. Service in general is excellent. All the front desk managers on every shift are helpful, courteous and efficient, with a special mention to Louis, who speaks excellent English and Italian, for his good advice. The lobby is comfortable and welcoming. There is a small garden terrace off the lobby where you can relax after a long day of sight seeing. We have been to Rome before and have stayed in other similar small hotels, but Hotel Farnese is the only one we would recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: oohahambulance
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fantastic. i booked it on the day i arrived and was able to get an amazing last minute deal, 110 euros for one night. the hotel is convenient to get to by metro, literally a 2 minute walk when you get out of the subway. the location is somewhat residential but it is a 15 min walk to the vatican (purpose of my trip) and a 15-20 min walk to the center (i walked it alone at night and felt safe). there is a complimentary included breakfast which was fantastic, taken on their rooftop terrace with really nice views. the hotel concierge was extremely helpful and even helped me plan a walking route to see the sights. the rooms are clean, larger showers than i have seen elsewhere in europe, and really comfortable beds. free wifi and a safe in the room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Farnese was excellent, no other word for it. Fabulous staff, lovely hotel, great breakfast (which isn't a buffet as it said on the site). It's within walking distance of many of the sights that you want to see in Rome, Vatican and Piazza del Poppolo to name two. Also within walking distance of very good restaurants, cafes and a superb street of shops. Definitely recommend this hotel it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay: convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicans_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Farnese three times in the last year and each time we have experienced the most gracious courtesy and help by the staff. The rooms are comfortable. The breakfast is excellent and the breakfast hostess an absolute jewel. It is located about a block from the metro and bus lines that take you almost to any place you want to see in Rome in minutes. So we find the hotel extremely convenient and we have come to prefer being a little out of the center and living in a real neighborhood away from the hawkers and hustle and bustle of tourists. The arrangements made to pick us up at the airport or the train station have been totally reliable and with terrific drivers. We'll be back and thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with a view”
Reviews.Author: Momoechan
Reviews.Content: We've been in Rome for a week end with some friends...we had a wonderful time, Farnese Hotel is very close to the centre (we've been going around on foot, as a maximum ten minutes from Via del Corso), nontheless the area is very quiet. It is very clean, the staff is really polite and...most of all...you'll have a wonderful view while having your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel at Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LouSDelrayBeach_FL
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a most satisfactory one week stay at the Hotel Farnese in Rome. Our room -- number 21--was average in size for a European four star hotel and adequately appointed. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Cleaning service was prompt and effective. The bathroom was quite large and had a large sink and a modern oversized tub with shower. Very, very comfortable and soothing after a long day of touring. The A/C was silent and quite effective, well above average for vintage European hotels in our experience. We like our room very cool for sleeping and couldn't help but think the Farnese would be an excellent choice for visitors in the broiling Roman summer. Also, while our room fronted on busy Viale Giulio Cesare, the double-paned windows were quite adequate to shield us from any street noise. The breakfast buffet, which included eggs and ham, cold cuts and cheese, cereals, fresh and prepared fruits --including the best baked apples this writer has ever tasted-- a variety of breads, juices and coffees was far better than just OK, and was served in a lovely enclosed "roof garden" with a view of the dome of Saint Peter's Basilica. The desk staff were helpful: most of our encounters at the reception were with the thoroughly charming Louis. We arrived at the hotel in a small taxi which charged us the stipulated E45 rate from the airport. Louis arranged a limousine service to return us to the airport for E50. The comfort of a Mercedes was certainly worth the extra E5. The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect! Just two blocks from the Tiber in an attractive mixed business and residential section of Prati. The Lepanto metro stop is one short block from the hotel, providing rapid access to the Piazzas di Spagna and Barberini, the Colosseum and Forum, Testaccio and the Vatican (next stop on the A line). At the same intersection, the 30 bus gets you to the Piazza Navona in 10 minutes and the 280 gets you toTrastevere/ Isola Tiberina in 15 minutes. All this and you can stroll to fine Prati restaurants like L'Arcangelo and Da Cesare in the evening after a glass of wine in the hotel lobby or its pleasant adjoining terrace. In sum, we found the Hotel Farnese to be a very good value indeed for a Roman accommodation. Our one grievance with the hotel is that not one of the many channels available on its TV offered English language news programming. I strongly recommend that the hotel provide access to CNN and/or BBC for guests from North America, the UK, Australia and other places where English is the mother tongue.

Reviews.Title: “there are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: vivianWestOrangeNj
Reviews.Content: the hotel seemed a bit pricey for what and where it is. Breakfast was ok. The woman at the desk gave us incorrect info on train schedule. Next time I will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience as part of our honeymoon to Italy”
Reviews.Author: rebel75
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here as part of our honeymoon during Easter. Rome was of course very busy, but this place was an oasis of calm to return to in the evenings. Breakfast was excellent, served on the roof terrace with view of the dome of St Peter's Basilica. Restaurant recommendations by the concierge were excellent - San Marco about 10 mins walk from hotel, and also Isola da Pizza about 15-20 mins walk. If you don't mind walking we found this location was ideal for exploring Rome on foot. But if not, the metro station was around the corner from the hotel and takes you to all the main sights. I think we paid €11 each for 3 day metro pass, also valid on buses - superb value and puts our outrageous travelcard fares here in London to shame!!! Vatican was about a 20 mins walk. This hotel is expensive but we felt it was worth the splurge as we were on honeymoon, and we have no regrets!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: Kmilcsik
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just a corner from Lepanto subway station and 15 minutes walk from St. Peter's Square. Lovely building, exquisite rooms, most careful housekeeping, helpful and professional service and a breathtaking view from the breakfast terrace. Average **** prices for an outstanding accomodation. Most recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem in an extraordinary city”
Reviews.Author: lkelsten
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were extremely comfortable; very clean room Conveniently located near bus and metro. Buffet breakfast was fantastic on a beautiful rooftop terrace overlooking the Vatican. Service was outstanding; Andrea was extremely helpful and pleasant, as was the entire staff. If I am ever in Rome again, I will most certainly return. THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL STAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mrscorrad
Reviews.Content: This was a sweet hotel, and the people were so friendly and helpful. Rooms are not huge, but comfortable. 1 block from metro and buses. Walking distance to the Vatican. Wonderful American breakfast every morning (included) in the rooftop dining room! Unfortunately in March it was cold and rainy, so the room was enclosed. Staff was able to give dinner and gelateria suggestions. 10 hours of free internet included. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuilfordHog
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable 3 night stay in this hotel. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Particular mention to the porter who has a very lovely manner. It is so refreshing to stay in a place where the staff are not expecting a tip! Breakfast was excellent; great cappucino and cakes. Room was a fair size, big bathroom (some may find the shower cubicle a bit small however) and we had a great balcony, which although a little too cold to sit out in February, made the stay feel special. I would definitely stay in this hotel again - not only for the comfort of the stay but also because it is close to the metro, vatican and in a nice non-touristy area.

Reviews.Title: “Utter luxury in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LynnClegg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in a perfect location a few metres from the subway, which takes you to every possible attraction in Rome. Restaurants are within easy walking distance. The breakfast room is charming, situated at the top of the hotel. Breakfast is superb with the most amazing choices. The staff are more than helpful and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are sound proofed and exquisite, real old fashioned Italian luxury. If I were visiting Rome again Farnese would be my 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic luxury hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Geo28
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days and i really enjoyed it. Farnese is a perfect hotel for those who want to avoid croudy hotels , and have a calm and quiet stay. Staff was really helpful, compliments to Andrea who made all things come true for us. Basic things iin our breakfast which is served in the roof floor and you can have a nice view of St Peters Dome. Best thing is the metro station Lepanto, just few steps from the entrance which can get you in 10 minutes in most touristic areas. Area very safe and Vaticano is 10 minutes away walking. On stop away is Isola del Pizza ,excellent restaurant for those who want to try good Italian recipes and of course Pizza.Ask the reception at Farnese to book you a table since it is always packed. I would recomend Farnese to everyone who has affordable luxury, location and calmness as their first criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: avonlae
Reviews.Content: Picked the Hotel after checking Tripadvisor reviews. Everthing about this charming hotel met and/or exceded our expectations. It was as if we were guests in a private Rome residence. Convenient location for Metro as well as within walking distance of many areas of interest. Buffet breakfast was great. We spent three very confortable nights at Hotel Farnese.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive yet unobtrusive”
Reviews.Author: robertcarter190728
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we had hoped for. A very attractive building in a residential part of the city. It felt much more part of the real, not tourist, Rome. close to the via Cola di Rienzo which is where the Romans shop. The atmosphere was informal, our room was well appointed and clean. The bed was comfortable, the breakfast was pleniful and varied; what really impressed us though was how the staff managed to be so attentive without us really noticing they were there. Marvellous

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and Elegant...from another era of Grand Tour charm.”
Reviews.Author: ParsRgood
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in this quiet and nicely decorated hotel. The front reception desk (especially Andrea, a stellar and lovely gentleman!) is very accommodating and attuned to your requests. For instance, our 6:30 am departure on the day we checked out meant we would have to miss breakfast, so they had two breakfast bags packed and ready to go when we left. The same choices were offered each morning for breakfast on the rooftop terrace (which is under cover) but the choices were varied and more than enough. Our room was wonderful and included a lovely terrace with a small table and two chairs as well as folding canvas beach chairs. We were able to take advantage of this space which made our accommodations seem even larger. The only downside was spotty maid service. The cleaning was fine, but occasionally she neglected to leave necessities such as plastic cups, bath mats, bars of soap. Small annoyances, but required a call to the front desk to have them delivered. We had read that the elevator was very slow, but did not find this to be true for us. The small bar off the lobby sitting room was a nice final stop after returning from dinner at the end of a long day. We enjoyed apertifs before turning in for the night. An elegant way to end a day exploring Rome. We hope to return one day and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LindaMorelli
Reviews.Content: No matter the purpose of your visit to Rome, the Hotel Farnese is a delightful place to stay. The hotel is located within a half-a-block walking distance to the local Metro and a 10 minute walk to the Vatican, and the front desk is manned 24 hours/day with a most knowledgeable and helpful staff. Our room was large, quiet and comfortable, boasting a king-sized bed, small fridge and flat screen TV. The bathroom provided accessories found only in the most luxurious of hotels, such as comfy cotton robes and slippers. The free breakfast on the roof terrace includes both hot and cold items, such as scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, various breads, fresh fruit and juices, a mouth-watering selection of cakes, freshly made cappuccino and other items too numerous to mention. The attendants are friendly and most willing to serve. A special thanks goes to Andrea and the entire staff for making our stay at this wonderful hotel all the more enable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Farnese”
Reviews.Author: mathro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week and enjoyed it immensley. All the staff were friendly and helpful, especially Andrea who helped us arrange a trip out to Atina where our grandfather came from. The standard of the room was great, the breakfast superb and the service from Gabriella excellent. Located close to restaurants, buses and metro, wouldn't hesitate to stay at Farnese again. Thanks you

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: QaisS
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel....very friendly staff....we specially enjoyed the honeymoon suite with its beautiful balcony

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Base to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: letsgoawayagain
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel Farnase after four wonderful days in Rome. This hotel is the ideal base to visit Rome as its so close to the Metro at Lapanto and provides a quiet comfortable stay in the heart of the tree lined streets of Prati. The rooms are superb, with big comfy beds, a decent sized bathroom, plentiful hot water and air conditioning. The breakfast terrace on the roof is a delight, and with a big choice of breakfast. However it is the staff that really make this a great place to stay. Andrew and his team ensured we found the best local restaurants, the right time to see the sights and avoid the queues,and was always on hand with tips and advice. I am always concerned about the honesty of reviews but in this case I can wholly recommend this hotel as one of the best we have stayed in. A big thank-you to everyone at Hotel Farnase for making our trip so enjoyable. Glyn, Jude, Phil and Julie from England

Reviews.Title: “A cozy and comfortable home in the middle of complicated Rome.”
Reviews.Author: rgiacosie
Reviews.Content: Staff behind the desk were outstanding and most helpful (a special thanks to Alex and Louis), the breakfast amazing and abundant and fresh, rooms clean and beautifully designed, and the graceful lobby soothing in a city that can be quite overwhelming. Can walk safely to Vatican, Spanish Steps, great shopping and wonderful restaurants, near gelaterias and street vendors too . Finding a charming hotel that is both part of the historical city, and a tad bit outside it can be tough. Hotel Farnese is just that. A perfect Roman villa feel in a neighborhood that is hundreds of years old. And the owner loves plants and flowers. The place is alive. A real gem. Can't wait to return. Bob Giacosie, Pam Klein and Maria Giacosie

Reviews.Title: “A perfect small hotel in a very good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Hoopie
Reviews.Content: Everything about this small hotel makes you want to come back again and again. The rooms are large for Europe and the baths are very spacious and clean. The buffet breakfast overlooking St. Peters in the background was delicious. The staff was above and beyond what you would expect. When my sister left her glasses in the taxi Alexsandra had called for us to go to the vatican,I called her and when we arrived back at the hotel they were waiting at the desk for us. Louis was also wonderful with maps and restaurant suggestions. We walked to dinner each night. A truly wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: hnaw
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Farnese in July 2010. The staff could not have been nicer and the location was perfect for us, 1 block to the metro line, 10 minute walk to the Vatican, in a very quite area! Super clean and comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic ... best of our 2 week stay in Italy (Venice, Florence, Rome). Small, quaint, hotel. Perfect if you are looking for an alternative to the big chain hotels. We will definitely stay again if we are back in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet location, great service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bob42763
Reviews.Content: We had a good recommendation from a friend, contacted the hotel by email and had informative correspondence with Andrea who helped us choose our room. Also the hotel arranged for us to be met at the end of our cruise by an excellent taxi company to take us to the hotel. At the end of our stay they also arranged for us to be taken to the airport at 4:00 a.m. for our flight back to the USA. Our room was large, cool and clean. The breakfast was an extensive buffet, served by Gabriella, who was a charming lady. Alexandra on the desk also provided us with information on places to eat and made us very welcome. Only 15 mins. walk to the Vatican and with the train station close by, together with our Roma Pass, it made it easy to get around Rome. Attractive quiet hotel with lots of flowers in pots around the courtyard made it a welcome place after a day of site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: NashR
Reviews.Content: Charming feeling of visiting an Italian relative, Count by title, but no longer in the money, hence renting rooms out to strangers. Very familial feeling to it, yet quite private. Very nice breakfast, free Wi-Fi (you have to start the session via browser as it requires user id and password each time, then times out in 10 minutes or so of inactivity, so it's a bit irritating, especially if you're using an iPhone). Highlight of rooms 41, 44 and 46 are balconies which are quite pleasant. The only downside is horrible cable and TVs so small that compared to 15 foot ceilings one can barely find a TV in a room, let alone see anything on it. But then again, you are not in Rome for watching TV, so bugger off and have a bottle of wine...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: petersonew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a week in Rome for our honeymoon. Our entire stay was at Hotel Farnese. We truly loved this hotel. We had the large honeymoon suite, and it was fantastic. The highlight was the staff; all were very engaging and helpful (and fluent in English which helps). The breakfast was great, and kept us coming back. The cappuccino was probably the best we had in Rome. The location is extremely convenient, walking distance (15-30 minutes) to most of Rome's attractions, and next to the metro for further travel. It is outside of the old town, but an easy walk. It is also very near to shopping areas. This is not in the touristy areas, which we found really wonderful. The hotel is small, so do not expect a large luxury hotel. Also, if you would like to be immediately in the old town, you may want to look near Navona (or elsewhere). A highly recommended hotel for a trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Farnese”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: This elegant hotel, located in a quiet residential part of Prati, is a wonderful location from which to base a Rome sightseeing trip. The Vatican is about a 15 minute walk; we also walked to other places on the other side of the river like the Spanish Steps and the Forum, but the best news is the Lepanto Metro station is literally 50m from the hotel; we did get sore feet at times and it was nice to have such convenient public transportation to fall back on. We booked a superior room with a *lovely* patio looking out over the rooftops. It was nice and quiet in this part of town and we slept wonderfully (which was not the case in the other 2 hotels we tried in Rome only a few blocks away. We wish we had just returned to the Farnese!) The staff is quite professional, they arranged a convenient airport transfer for us via email and you can rely on their excellent restaurant recommendations (not the tourist traps that other hotels like to point you toward). Their breakfast is very good, and the room they serve it in... looking out over the rooftops... was very romantic, even at 8AM! The woman helping out with breakfast was particularly pleasant, and she makes a mean cappuccino, you only have to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent hotel with character and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ibeenthereandthere
Reviews.Content: This really is a nice hotel and i consider myself very lucky to have found it! Best thing about this place is the breakfast room on the 5th floor. absolutely gorgeous way to wake up in a sun filled elegent rooftop terrace Rooms are not in a classic Italian style so it you're into altra modern this may not be for you. Location is good but not in the beating heart of the centre...still easy enough to walk and in a very elegent district none the less. You wouldn't get a place this nice with everything included in the centre... highly reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and a nice room”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaElizabeth
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Hotel Farnese is the staff; everyone was extremely nice and helpful. When we had to catch an early flight, they thoughtfully gave us bags of yogurt, juice, and crackers for the airport. The regular breakfast was good, with fresh squeezed juice and cappucino. Our room was large and the bathroom unusually large for Europe. I would recommend asking for a room facing away from the street, since it's quite busy. The hotel is not located in a particularly pretty part of Rome, but it felt perfectly safe. It took us about 20-25 minutes to walk to St. Peter's Basilica.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & elegant comfort service & privacy with your family”
Reviews.Author: mermaidincoldwater
Reviews.Content: This is the comfortable elegant choice for family and business travelers in Prati. (or Rome for that matter) My husband and I travelled with our parents and our very active 5 year old son. The kindness and professionalism of the staff calmly and competentl accomodated the needs of all whether it was recomendations for dinner,calls for taxi, shedules for trains to Tuscany, toy shops or the emergency room. The rooms were quiet elegant and spotless. The windows are double paned, if you are particularly sensitive ask for rooms that do not broach on via gjuliu cesare. The breakfast room had a selection that included do it yourself squeezed blood orange juice, a barista & everything else that was delicious with a charming view of Roman rooftops including St. Peters.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helge R
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Hotel Farnese twice the last 3 months and I recommend it. Great location close to the metro and within walking distance to most of the attractions in Rome. The surroundings are quiet and the staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with a special atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SeuteDeern
Reviews.Content: A 2 1/2 days business stay in Rome with allday meetings and no time to see the city - and I remember it with joy because of our location in the Hotel Farnese: a very nice atmosphere that starts in the attractive lobby, small but comfortable and clean rooms, very nice and quiet sort of residential part of the town (I even heard a wren (scricciolo) sing outside my window ), a lovely breakfast room (with a very good buffet of all sorts) on the roof where over rooftops and pinetrees you even can see St.Peter's Dome! And very important: extremely friendly and competent staff, at the reception on that weekend mostly Sognore Louis!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Quite Location”
Reviews.Author: PLJEH
Reviews.Content: We chose the Farnese through reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. On arrival Andrea helped us with our bags and gave us lots of advise. Our room was comfortable with a lovely ensuite bathroom, comfortable bed (even an extra pillow on request) and very quiet, no noise from the street or other guests. In the morning we had a delicious breakfast with plenty to choose, from the usual cold meats and cheeses to egg and bacon as well as delicious cakes and croissants. You could also have do it yourself freshly squeezed orange juice, followed by a yummy capuccino, all this with a lovley view across the rooftops to St Peters. The location was ideal too, just metres from the metro (Lepanto) where you can just hop on and reach most parts of the city. We managed to see all the majors sites in three days but had very tired feet, a cup of tea on arrival back at the hotel was very welcome. Lewis on reception helped us with restaurant bookings in the evenings, again either reached by the metro or within walking distance. All in all, we thoroughly recommend The Hotel Farnese and wil be returning asap.

Reviews.Title: “A very Pleasant Weekend, A Nightmare made good.”
Reviews.Author: Travler76
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Farnese Hotel, We were welcomed by the lovely Andrea who was most accommodating and extremely helpful throughout our entire stay. the Hotel itself was impeccably clean, Tidy and very quiet. The Metro station is within falling distance from the door which was immensely useful, (There is obviously a lot to see and do in Rome and it was fantastic to be delivered by the Metro system directly to your door) I would Highly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting the city. Having arrived in Rome for a much anticipated long weekend, We arrived at the Hotel Farnese rather by default. we had planned to stay at the Twentyone hotel whom despite having taken our booking several months in advance, Advised us that they have no record of our booking, Then they admitted they were double booked but still turned us away even though they were accepting later arrivals as we stood in reception!!! - VERY BAD INDEED! Avoid the Twentyone at all costs. Thanks to Andrea and the Hotel Farnese - It was indeed a very pleasant weekend and a Nightmare made good. All thoughts of the "other place" quickly evaporated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the Hotel Farnese”
Reviews.Author: Hope-and-Dreams
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel; very helpful staff (thanks to Andrea at the front desk for all the help); nice neighborhood; quiet rooms; excellent air conditioning - which was definitely appreciated after a long day of sightseeing; breakfast was lovely - incl. capuccino and view. Have told all my friends about it; wouldn't stay anywhere else. Made reservations via email; very responsive and helpful staff from pre-arrival through departure.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, special retreat in a hectic city!”
Reviews.Author: gunnerside43
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a thursday for a 4 day visit and were met by nothing short of perfect hospitalty! Our room looked out onto a roman streetscape with greenery, rusty-coloured neighbouring building and views over rooftops. I had also ordered roses and a chilled bottle of wine to be waiting on our arrival, and this was beautifully arranged as we walked in. Absolutely super! Breakfast on the top floor (reached only by the lift) was excellent with freshly pressed orangejuice, cappuccino and a broad display of continental breakfast choices. (not the selection of sweet danish etc. that we have had in other hotels in Italy). The view over the rooftops towards the Vatican is amazing! One can also reach an upper roof terrace where you can take your coffee/tea after breakfast to sample the view and discuss the days journey! The potted hedge up there could need a little trim as it´s quite thick, but it´s a minor thing. Our top marks go nevertheless to the staff, whom we enjoyed stopping and talking to as long and often as possible. The owner of this hotel has a real knack for hiring staff that are kind, interesting and always helpful! A BIG thanks to Lois and the gang - you made our stay wonderful! THANK YOU! kind regards Erik and Justine / Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly professional staff - first class.”
Reviews.Author: CDMManchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located being about halfway between the Vatican and the huge park Villa Borghese. Both are walkable although the metro stop Lepanto is on the corner and can really help with these and other locations. Rooms follow on from the reception being classy and quite plush. The only drawback is the lack of in-room tea/coffee making facilities. Air con worked very well. Although the streets can be busy in the area no noise penetrates into the rooms, having shutters, double glazing and heavy curtains. Breakfast choice is ample and is taken on the roof terrace under an awning. Mostly the stand-out feature of this hotel is the quality of the care and welcome from the staff. Many we got to know on first name terms and they were exemplary, a great credit to this establishment and we wish them well - and hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - like coming home”
Reviews.Author: 76DAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 5 nights. Arrived in the hotel at 11 a.m. and until 30 min. our room was ready. They upgraded us, got a nice double bed room (king size bed). Not very big, but ok for 2 and the luggage. Very nice room, clean, air condition, mini bar - everything ok. The hotel style is like an old manor house, everything nice (for some maybe oldfashioned) and tastefull decorated. Very luxurious buffet breakfast (not common in Italy!) with ham, eggs, cheese, sweets etc. The stuff was extremly polite and helpfull! We got very good tips for dinner, they made also the reservations. For some maybe a minus, they have no restaurant, but there are a lot of restaurants/trattorias outside in walking distance. Location is quite ok - north of the Vatican, walking distance to Vatican app. 15-20 min; Piazza del Popolo app. 10 minutes. Metrostation 20m from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet place with great breakfast and free parking”
Reviews.Author: VAbr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Farnese with all our family 3 days in the end of August and enjoyed from its location in quiet Prati (5 minutes walk from Lepanto Metro and 15 minutes from Piazza Spagna and Vatican Museums), great breakfast, free parking, and very attentive service always giving with helpful maps correct descriptions, advices , and recommendaions.

Reviews.Title: “A Boutique Gem”
Reviews.Author: DeuceHussey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Farnese for 5 nights in early September. Lovely terraced room. Great location in a quiet area, close to Lepanto Metro. Excellent service at Reception - great information, maps and recommendations. Top class breakfast. Dublin couple

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Our room was BUGLARIZED!!”
Reviews.Author: jagbear1
Reviews.Content: A horrible ending to a fantasy trip!! We checked in for 3 days on Tues July 7 and thought "what a wonderful hotel... We were WRONG!! We went out for ice cream and returned 35 minutes later to find out stuff had been gone through and all our electronics, computer, kindle, jewelery, cash taken!! The front desk person , Angelo and housekeeper, Jasmine were no help, He did not want to call the police, she was acting very strangley, especially when I said maybe the kindle had a tracking device, she pulled out her cell phone and headed down the hall speaking Italian to the desk clerk. We are devastated. What a bad decision to trust this seemingly charming hotel. we spent 2 days with the police and went to the embassy for help. BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE!!

Reviews.Title: “A very charming hotel with excellent service and breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsDuck40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet area just across the Tiber about a 10 minute walk to the Piazza del Popolo and 20 munutes to the Spanish steps. We loved escaping the madness of central Rome and getting back to this little gen of a hotel. Our room was small but beautifully furnished and the bathroom was bright and surprisingly large. Best of all were the fabulour breakfasts served on the roof top garden room where we enjoyed lovely views including the dome of St. Peter's. The breakfast included every imaginable food you could think of and the attendant went out of her way to be pleasant to each guest, offering to make us cappachinos, including seconds, even though she was obviously very busy with a full room. Front desk staff were equally friendly and very helpful at all times. Noticing from his passport that the day we arrived was my husband's bithday, they sent up champagne to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: PaulSussexUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights during April. The Farnese is a very comfortable 4* hotel and is located in a pleasant, tree-lined, residential area. It is close to Via Cola di Rienzo, a lovely main shopping street which leads to the Vatican & St. Peter's. The Pantheon, Spanish Steps are also within 20-30 minutes walking distance. It is however easy to catch a 'bus if required (Reception have tickets and it is only 1 euro for anything up to a 75 minute journey). Our comfortable, superior room was on the 4 th.floor, with all amenities: bathrobes, slippers, fresh linen daily, and had a small balcony. The whole hotel is nicely kept and there is a pleasant, attractively decorated lounge on the ground floor. The staff at the Farnese are outstanding, helpful and courteous. Breakfast is a great delight - Gabriella is charming and explains all the options: cappucino etc. The breakfast ranges from cereals, cold meats, cheese, eggs/bacon, croissants, breads, cakes, and could not be better; and all this is eaten in the breakfast room on the 5 th. floor overlooking St. Peter's dome! We flew from England to Rome Fiumicino and for fun decided to transfer to Rome Termini by train. This worked very well but the walking distances at the airport and Termini are quite long. The hotel are very happy however to arrange a taxi transfer if preferred (see their web site for details) A most enjoyable holiday; we are very happy to recommend the Farnese which is well-worthy of its 4* rating. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, fantastic breakfast room and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: EmemBath
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the hotel, staying in room number 31. It was bigger than I had expected given previous Trip Advisor posts. The sleeping area consisted of a vast and comfortable double bed (with good bed linen) and a day bed for a third occupant. There is also a wall mounted flat screen TV with BBC News 24 and CNN. However, we were able to watch the football (UEFA Champions League semi) on RAI 2. If you are conscious of your looks then this is not the room for you (or perhaps it is) as there were six enormous mirrors in the rooms. Or eight, if you count the three mirrored wardrobe doors which I’ve counted as one. The other mirrors are above the dressing table area (with the mini-bar fridge below to the left of where you sit), on the wall opposite the door, above the sink in the bathroom and on the back of the bathroom door. The wardrobe contains the safe and spare pillows and blankets. There are no drawers but a small amount of shelving in the wardrobe which wasn’t really adequate for two so we resorted to the glass shelf above the hanging space but given my diminutive stature I would not have been able to reach (so my husband’s smalls were stored there). The bathroom was large and mainly tiled with a big, corner bath with mixer shower over. There was a bidet, toilet and a very large sink. There was also a small stool and wheeled shelving unit for your toiletries. The complimentary tray was basic: soap, shower gel, shower caps, tissues and two sachets of ‘personal hygiene’ liquid. There were nice big towels which were stored on a heated towel rail and which were changed daily. (I don’t like this practice as I think that it’s environmentally unfriendly but others may have a different view.) The plumbing was idiosyncratic as sometimes the hot supply spluttered as a result of air in the system; so beware when you turn it on as it may suddenly come out in an enormous splash. The tiled floor had a couple of cracks, there was what looked like a small cigarette burn on the side of the bath and the plug operating system didn’t work (the plastic cover came off when you turned it) so you had to prise the plug out to let the water run away. On our first evening we went out for a meal and on our return found that not only had the maid turned down the bed but had tastefully laid out our pyjamas (and I’d brought a functional pair, not a slinky number) so we hid our nightclothes on subsequent days. When we went to bed we tried to sleep with the window open but as this room is side onto the busy (and very noisy) Viale Giulio Cesare we discovered that the window system is extremely efficient. The outer layer is a traditional slatted shutter. The next layer is a triple glazed window and the third layer is an internal shutter. When all three are used they cut out most of the noise and all of the light so you may need an alarm clock to wake you as you will be unaware of the morning unfolding and you won’t want to miss breakfast. This for me was the best bit of the hotel; the rooftop breakfast room. At the time we stayed (late April) it was largely covered but I believe that it is opened in the summer. However you still get great views across the Roman rooftops of the beautiful dome of San Gioacchino (well worth a visit if you like Pre-Raphaelite decoration) and St Peter’s. The buffet style breakfast is very varied and good quality so I won’t list all the items (but who eats chocolate torte for breakfast?). The helpful, friendly waitress’ willingness to make fresh cappuccino and espresso has already been documented but I liked being able to squeeze our own oranges for really fresh juice. The rest of the staff were friendly and helpful (although we weren’t overly enthralled by the desk clerk’s recommendations for dinner – avoid the Porto di Ripetta in the Via di Ripetta unless you have deep pockets and can stand the obsequious owner but the Perilli in Prati in Via Otranto was probably the best of the bunch). All in all a good, relaxing, if expensive experience.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mowog4
Reviews.Content: Louis and Alessandra were beyond great, they make the stay wonderful. The room was clean, well apppointed, and very much in the theme of the rest of the hotel. The Hotel Farnese was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful individual hotel in excellent, yet tranquil, location to explore all of Rome”
Reviews.Author: hunts_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Farnese, which is situated in a lovely, peaceful and safe residential area (close to Le Panto metro). Most of the main sights can be reached within 15/20 minutes walking, including the Spanish Steps, Castel Sant Angelo, Trevi fountain, Pantheon, the Vatican City and St. Peters; the only time we used the metro was to visit the Colloseum and Palatino. We had a lovely room, beautifully decorated with high ceilings, a large full equipped bathroom and also a balcony just over the reception area, so we could sit out and relax in the February sunshine and watch the Romans go about their daily business! As soon as we passed through the door, we were personally welcomed by name and from then on looked after with impecable care throughout our stay. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean and has many interesting works of art - check out the family tree in the reception and the history of Alessandro Farnese, after whom the hotel is named. A very good breakfast was served up on the top floor, overlooking the dome of St. Peters -this set us up for the day's sightseeing! We enjoyed our lunchtimes around the Pantheon plaza, (perhaps a little expensive), but we enjoyed just sharing a salad and a plate of anchovies, washed down with a bottle of wine and watching the world go by for a couple of hours - this was most refreshing after all the sightseeing of the morning. Would definitely recommend asking the concierge for advice on eating out in the evening - he suggested a very good local restaurant close to the hotel with excellent food and service - the waiter took pride in translating the blackboard menu to us in great detail and we enjoyed this meal greatly compared to the tourist trap restaurants in the centre. We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JayMemphis
Reviews.Content: During a previous trip to Rome, we had noticed a hotel with the name Farnese in it and when we tried to google it, we came up with the Hotel Farnese . Even though we didn't think it was the hotel we had seen, we decided to go with the Hotel Farnese. It was a wonderful choice. The hotel is in a residential neighborhood, but minutes away from shopping , great restaurants and the center. There is a metro stop right around the corner. Originally we had a room on the first floor, but we could hear the desk telephone during the night and we asked to switch to an upper floor. The staff was most welcoming and helpful and we loved having breakfast near the rooftop. The bathrooms were modern and the hotel decor very charming.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Way to End a Trip”
Reviews.Author: jwave45
Reviews.Content: We ended our 2+ weeks in Italy with 2 nights at this charming hotel. We were greeted promptly and warmly. We had room 44. It was not huge but was larger than I expected. We even had a small terrace with a table and 2 chairs. I loved the windows with shutters. We were able to keep the windows open at night but the shutters blocked light and sound. Our beds were comfortable and the minibar and safe were welcome additions. The bathroom was immaculate with a large bath/shower combination. Breakfast on the roof terrace was lovely and bright, with many options including bacon and eggs. We had a lovely lemon tart and a pot of tea, with fresh squeezed orange juice. We did not get to enjoy breakfast our second morning, as we had an early flight, but we had a great stay any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacAyrshire_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for my sons 21st birthday. What a fantastic little hotel. The rooms were very well appointed and individually designed which made it much more homely than the usual hotel chains. Bathrooms were well equipped and spacious. Really nice touches such as turn down service and complimentary hotel slippers. The whole hotel was immaculately clean and very well laid out. Staff could not have been more helpful and spoke very good english. Breakfast roof terrace has amazing views and good choice for breakfast. The coffee is lovely! Very convenient location in a really nice neighbourhood which was easy walking distance of all the sights. However, if you prefer to go by metro its right outside and hotel staff will provide tickets for you. Has a nice little terrace garden where staff will happily provide you with reasonably priced drinks in the evening if you so wish. All in all we had a fantastic stay and would most definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “You wont be disappointed !!”
Reviews.Author: 3IA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 week trip to Italy ending in Rome. We stayed in many hotels during our trip and can honestly say we loved Hotel Farnese, a great treat to end our trip . The hotel staff was very professional, helpful and pleasant. They accomadated our every need and went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed guests. The location can't be beat an easy walk to many popular attractions and the merto right across the street was wonderful. The street is charming and very safe and there was always an attendant at the desk at any hour and knew who was coming and going from the hotel. The rooms were beatifully decorated and maniatined. The hotel was very quite too. The bathrooms were exceptioanlly clean and modern but with european charm. They offer a very nice breakfast,better than other places we stayed, with a beautiful roof top view. You would be a missing a great experince if you let this one pass you by.

Reviews.Title: “a Great Spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rljlmj
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in Italy with our 12 year old grandson, and the Farnese was a great place to stay with him. The junior suite had plenty of room for the 3 of us, a nice large bathroom, and a sliding door between the sleeping areas for some privacy. The staff was extremely helpful, and the breakfast on the rooftop terrace was delicious. We were one block from a metro stop, and in walking distance of many of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, smart and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khanov
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights on our honeymoon. It has a great location, you can walk to virtually anywhere in central Rome, and the metro stop is 100m from the hotel for longer or the return journey. Staff excellent and helpful, spoke superb English. Our room seemed a little small for 220 Euros, but I suspect that is what you have to pay for 4 star in central Rome. Nice decoration and clean throughout. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE Italy-the Farnese is a good place!”
Reviews.Author: mat'sgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at the the Hotel Farnese in '07 and it is hard to say anything negative about this hotel. I LOVE Italy and have made it my adopted "home," so I am hard pressed to say ANYTHING negative about the nation! When in Rome in '05, my husband and I had stayed at the Capo D'Africa, which is hard to beat. But the Farnese was great, too! This hotel is conveniently located on Via Alessandro Farnese, a main thoroughfare that runs near the edge of the old city of Rome. Only 3-4 blocks from a main subway line, getting around Rome from the Farnese is a snap! What's very cool about this hotel is that it sits right near the Tiber River, so it is VERY near Vatican City, St. Peter's Basilica and the Castle Saint Angelo but also near many historic Roman city sites, which are accesible by subway, taxi, bus or foot! One thing to remember, this hotel is on the complete opposite side from the Coloseum, the Imperial and Roman Forums, the Campidoglio, etc...so, if you want to stay near the ancient ruins and such, just realize that this hotel is on the complete other end of the city...but you can get to those sites easily from the Farnese. Our room at the Farnese was great. While a bit small (typical for rooms in Italy, esp Rome), the room was beautifully furnished, cozy and very clean. The shower and bathroom were great and spotless. The shower (by Italian standards) was big and the room's queen sized bed was VERY comfortable. We even had a little patio with 2 chairs and a table overlooking the street behind the Hotel Farnese. The hotel, which was once a private residence for Italian aristocrats, is beautifully decorated and dates back to 1906. Breakfasts were great and typical for Rome (boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, juices, cappuccino, pastries, croissants, breads, etc) but very fresh and tasty. I could eat b'fast like this EVERYDAY, 'cause I'm not a hot breakfast freak (sausage, meat, potatoes, hot eggs, pancakes), etc. I LOVE the Italians in Italy and the personnel at the Farnese were no exception. While not overly fuzzy and effusive, the front desk folks were efficient, polite and very helpful. The concierge arranged transportation for us on several occasions. If you do not speak Italian, everyone at the hotel speaks some English (minus our wonderful housekeeper, with whom I communicated with in Italian...my very poor Italian)! Here's the best...in our haste to make it to our airport on our last morning, my husband left several $100's worth of majolica behind, in our room's closet. This recollection came to us while we were on Alitalia, somewhere over the Atlantic Ocean! Of course, being Americans from New York City, we were certain that the majolica would be lifted or stolen. Well, after one call to the Farnese, the manager located and secured the items (which had been turned in by housekeeping)and they reassured me that they would safely ship the pieces out to the USA. We worked out a payment option and despite a cost of over $140 US dollars (yep, I know), the majolica arrived. Now, it was NOT the Farnese's fault...one VERY fragile piece was broken, (which I think my husband had accidentally broken in transit). But the other, less fragile pieces, arrived in perfect shape. Nonetheless, I could tell that the Farnese staff went through extra effort to safely package and ship the majolica. I couldn't imagine another hotel (except those in Italy-smile) going through all the trouble to secure, safely pack, post and mail several pieces of sizeable majolica! THANK YOU HOTEL FARNESE! What else can I say? I love Italy, I love Rome and the Farnese is a great place. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone planning to visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with service to match”
Reviews.Author: mca13159
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Farnese from 12/15-12/20/07. We booked directly with the hotel and received a great deal on room 46. The room includes a large terrace with a limited view of St. Peter's. It's a top floor room, large, quiet and very comfortable. The bathroom includes a full tub and is marble with a heated towel rack and heated floors. The hotel serves a full breakfast buffet daily from 7am until 10am. If you want a cappucino just ask, it will be made fresh. The buffet always included warm pastries, bacon and egs, fresh meats and cheeses, freshly squeezed orange juice, yogurt and fresh fruit. Service was attentive and the setting is on the 5th floor with a lovely view of the neighborhood and St. Peters. During the summer the canopy can be opened and there is extra room on an adjacent terrace to eat outdoors. The hotel includes a small bar, internet access via wireless and a computer for use at a nominal price. The sevice from the entire staff was excellent. Whether you need directions, airport transfers or reservations we always received excellent service. The hotel is located in an upscale neighborhood, a few blocks off a main street. The Lepanto metro station is just a few steps away but frankly we walked everywhere. The Vatcan Museum is 15 minutes, Piazza de Puoplolo is only 10, The Coloseum took about 30 minutes but was very pleasant as we took the Via de Corso route and stopped for Sunday Mass along the way. Navonna is about 15 minutes walk at most. We ate all around town but did have great pizza about 5 blocks from the hotel at San Marco Pizza. It's a local place with good pasta, pizza and the house wine was just 8E per bottle. You won't go wrong at the Hotel Farnese.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Farnese”
Reviews.Author: plantholt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Farnese from Nov 24, 2007 to Nov 29, 2007. From the moment I arrived (they made arrangements for a car to pick me up at the airport) to the moment I left I was treated like royalty. The staff we're truly amazing. I had traveled all over the world for business and pleasure, and this place is a must stay. You feel like you're staying over a friends house. It's clean and cozy. And the rooms are comfortable and welcoming. Internet is available in a small room near the lobby (3 euro for 1 hour of internet time). The hotel is located near every major attraction (centrally located). But make sure you bring your walking shoes, because it's the best way to travel. It's about a 15minute walk to the Vatican or you can walk to the Piazza De Popolo to shop in just under a 10minutes. I had a blast during my stay in Rome and Farnese was part of the reason. The breakfast is a buffet on the top floor situated in an closed in room.
