You can view the entire city while your stuffing down a fresh croissant or enjoying eggs, pastries or whatever else your in the mood for. It really was great food!!. Overall this place is a must stay and you won't be disappointed. Forget the bad reviews anyone has left about this place, because I just was there and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “So romantic and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ShonaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: After spending two weeks on tour, we checked into Hotel Farnese for our final two days in Italy, in Roma. Although we spent our tour in 4 and five star hotels, which were all nice, we were pleasantly surprised when we checked into this Hotel. From the moment we walked through the door we were treated like royality!! The pleasant welcome from the desk staff and the help we received with our luggage was just so personal. The ambience of the Hotel ,our room along with the Breakfast area was just beautiful, and the staff so very pleasant and helpful-we felt like they were there to look after-just us!! We were never aware of anyone else there, except for breakfast time in the beautiful rooftop restarant-with its amazing views of St Peters Basilica. I would recommend this Hotel 100%. We have been married for 37 years ,and this experience made it feel like a second honeymoon!! Just lovely -please consider this small but friendly Hotel over the other 'chains'- you will never regret it. Incidently was is our fifth trip to Italy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the Staff, plus the Little Touches”
Reviews.Author: Slow_Pony
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience. I would just be repetitious by listing all the things that contributed to a great stay at this fabulous property. Best staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in, and I've stayed in a lot. The little touches make all the difference here to create a memorable stay. Let me address a couple of issues I have seen in other reviews. I did have noise through my open window facing the main street, however when closed it was not an issue and there was no need for that window to be open anyway since the air conditioner worked great. I didn't notice much noise from my window facing the side street. The shower did have a tendency to put a lot of water on the floor, but I determined it was the side vent showerheads causing this. When we used just the overhead showerhead, it was just fine. Being right next to Lepanto Metro station made it easy to get around. Food great, service great, beautiful hotel. They never steered us wrong with their restaurant recommendations. Our trip was worth staying at this hotel. The fact it happened to be in Rome was just a bonus. Highest compliment I can give is that not only would I stay here again, I would really look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, charming, EXCELLENT service!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen.allen
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this place. It was very quaint place from the front door man in a tux with tails to the maid in her french uniform. It was not "fancy" but it was clean and the bathroom was great. HUGE tube and dome ceiling. We missed our flight and returned to stay in the smaller room, which was small, but much cheaper and met our needs for the extra night. We highly recommend this hotel. It's not what you would call 5 stars, per say, but it had hard wood through out, marble bathrooms, and extra touches like brunch everyday on the roof. It was very clean and the service was IMPECCABLE(better then many 5 star hotels that I have stayed in)! We will stay again. See my other submitted pics.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with a fine staff ... but ...”
Reviews.Author: ewilson648
Reviews.Content: The Farnese is a very good hotel with an outstanding staff, but there are issues of which travelers should be aware. The staff, including especially Alessandra, Marco, and, in particular, Andrea, could not have been more accommodating. Each of them, plus the housekeeper Maria Gabriella, did everything in their power to make us comfortable. The Farnese's rooms, while not huge, are quite average for Rome (we've stayed in literally dozens of hotels there) and are of above average comfort with fine beds and linens. The standards of cleanliness are among the highest we've ever seen. The hotel is NOT as quiet as some reviews indicate. Via Giulio Cesere runs beside the hotel and is very busy and noise from motorcycles is persistent. Rooms 42 and 43, the ONLY connecting rooms in the whole hotel, are directly beneath the breakfast room and there is noise from both the street and from above. The showers in the Farnese were designed during the inquisition as torture devices. They are VERY small and flooding is common. Even the rooms with a tub (where the showers are larger) have flooding issues because of poor design. The location is very good, close to one of Rome's best shopping districts (Via Colla di Rienzo). The area abounds in good, reasonable restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Dogs Barking All Night Long In The Back”
Reviews.Author: InEurope
Reviews.Content: My first mistake was to book this on the internet. I thought I was booking directly through the hotel, but in fact I was booking through a third party which added 30 Euro to the cost of the room. The hotel is nice, small rooms, good beds, nice decor, but the power to my room failed twice, the safe in the room didn't work, the sink stopped up, the shower was small and WORST of all the neighbors next door have two large dogs that bark throughout the night (in the back of the hotel). Even with the windows closed I woke every night, many times, to barking dogs, Ugh! I never felt rested except when it poured rain, and the dogs were kept inside all night long. That was a nice night. I am in my room now, and they are barking as I write this. Rome doesn't have any ordinances against barking or nuisance dogs. Trust me, they will keep you awake most of the night. Don't book a room in the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Castiga
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Farnese over the Easter break. I chose it because i could not stay anylonger at Relais Vaticano Hotel across the Road (Nightmare hotel from hell). Farnese was nearest and I explained what i have been through at Relais. They have been helpfull and offered me a room. The price was not at all bad given the fact that i did not book in advance. The room was clean and tidy with an LCD tv on he wall. All channels included(Englisn, French, Italian,etc..) The breakfast was by far the best in town. The rooftop garden was oustanding and having your. breakfast up there with the beautiful view was just breath taking. quiet hotl with lift that works. We also had a nice lift back to the airport arranged by the hotel The staffs were friendly, kind and very helpful when asked about restaurents, locations and day planning. I will definately go back there if in Rome again. Me and my girlfriend will be forever grateful for the service and the help received at Farnese after the dreadful experience at Relais Vaticano booked through Romeby.com(see review) Thanks a lot Farnese for the wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel With Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCHawaiian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the easter vacation. It was a little hike to the major monuments (i.e. spanish steps, trevi fountain). But for the price its not so bad. Vatican is close by and can be reached by a 15 minute walk. Rooftop breakfast is wonderful with beautiful view and scrumptous foods. A+++++++++++ Definately I would stay again.. when in ROME

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: glc74
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Farnese. The staff was the friendliest and most helpful of the 5 hotels we stayed in during our trip to Italy. Our room was beautifuly decorated, bed was comfortable, and we loved the linen sheets! Breakfast was good, the location was convienient to the Metro and the Vatican. The only drawback was the shower- it was terrible! The stall was microscopic, the water took forever to warm up, and the shower doors had to be fixed "just so" otherwise water would get all over the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: LuizTrip
Reviews.Content: What a gem! The Farnese is not located in the center of Rome but rather close to the Vatican and St. Peter's square. For leisure travelers thus it might be a bit inconvenient but I would not exchange the feeling of being at a palace for a more central location! Because that's how you feel at the Farnese: luxury with class and good taste. Everything is brand new but they kept the old-style decorations and furniture. Service is "impecable". The only minor inconvenience is that, in spite of all the sound-proof windows and isolation, those that have sensitive ears may find it a bit noisy after 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, good location”
Reviews.Author: traveler076
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple, and the room was the smallest and shabbiest of the hotels during our trip to Italy. The bathroom is small but otherwise adequate. The cleaning service is attentive. There is no Internet connection available in the room, although there is a station in the lobby area for an extra fee. The streets outside are very quiet. The elevator is very small and painfully slow. We lazy Americans took the stairs up and down to the third floor instead. In terms of amenities, the hotel doesn't really deserve its 4 star designation. On the other hand, the staff is very helpful and pleasant. The included breakfast is good (I enjoyed putting together my scrambled egg and prosciutto on toast sandwiches), and the staff there brought us fresh cappuccinos on demand. Location of the hotel is excellent. Although it may look some distance from the tourist sites on a map, it is a half block to a metro station, which is the most convenient way to get to the sites. A bus stop is only a couple blocks away. The location will also give you a nice opportunity to explore the shops and restaurants in the neighborhoods west of the Tiber river.

Reviews.Title: “Like meeting a friend from home”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue, and sadly brief, but very much deserved review. The Farnese was the first place my wife and I reached on a 3week stay in Europe. Throughout much of our trip, we looked back and missed the Farnese. The breakfasts were fantastic, (what amazing ham), the service was extraordinary, and proximity to the Vatican was excellent (we walked there twice). The rooftop was being worked on when we were there but we were allowed to shoot some pics. When it is finished, it will be a memorable place to share breakfast and after dinner drinks. The neighborhood is an eclectic residential mix and not at all touristy… which was GREAT. The rooms are a tad small, but well sized for Europe. One minor gripe, all rooms lack warm colored incandescent bedside lamps…, ticky-tack I know, but florescent light diminishes the elegance of the rooms. Lastly, I can’t end this review without mentioning Louis; he greeted us with a bear hug and a broad smile, and is a magician with requests. Worth his weight in gold, or at least a golden tip, trust him and he will ensure a smashing time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dolce1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-November. The location is good. It is about a 15 minute walk to St. Peter’s (you can see the dome of St. Peter’s from the hotel’s rooftop terrace). It is also very close to the Lepanto metro stop. We stayed in a superior room on the top floor. The room was nice and very clean. It included a balcony which was lovely with a patio table and chairs and lots of plants and flowers. The bed was very comfortable and the linen sheets were fine. An earlier reviewer had stated the sheets were scratchy, but I did not find this to be true at all. The windows were very well soundproofed (very quiet during the night). The bathroom was very clean and well equipped and included a hairdryer. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. It included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, cereal, yogurt, cheese, fruit, and more. This hotel is a very good value for Rome and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave63
Reviews.Content: Our recent rip to italy started in Rome. we had a pleasnat stay at Hotel Farnese. The beds are comfortable, even the pull out sofa bed that my mother had slept on. breakfast was the best that we had ( we stayed in Florence and Venice also), plenty for our american appetites, scambled eggs, and all the other items were just wonderful. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The area is convenient and nice. We walked some, called for taxis, and walked some more at other times, never a problem. Pizzeria San Marco has excellent food ( not far away) and convenient hours. They also print your bill out computerized -nice I would stay at this small boutique hotel again. They have most of what I expect from a small hotel. Cleanliness, pleasant staff, great breakfast, nice location, honesty

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabricqueen
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Hotel Farnese was wonderful the hotel is in a great location walking distance to the Vacatian and the staff was so nice Andrea our night deskman was very helpful. We had such a nice stay that we returned on the backend of our trip for 2 more days!! I highly recommend staying at the Farnese . JM /San Mateo Ca.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleasant Staff but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dermab
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Hotel Farnesse. I booked the hotel based on its high ratings on Trip Advisor. When I came home, I was amazed to see how far down on the list the hotel has dropped. Our room was comfortable and the bathroom very nice. The neighborhood was safe and quiet although there was a barking dog outside our window all week. A metro stop is one block away and it took us 15 minutes to walk to the Vatican. It was nice to get away from all the crowded tourist areas across the Tiber. I would have have liked a safe in the room but we had easy access to the hotel safe via the front desk. The hotel arranged a car to and from the airport for 55 Euros. The evening clerk Andrea was so pleasant to be with, he made the stay there worthwhile. However, in general the hotel is overpriced for its location (across the Tiber). The Metro is very easy to use and helped us a lot (except the day it closed because of a lethal crash) but unless you need to stay in that section of Rome for a special reason, I would look for a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pecg
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Farnese to be a friendly quaint hotel in the quiet Prati neighborhood of Rome. Excellent staff who were more than helpful with advise and tour information (Alexandra and Lewis). Would certainly recommend to others and would return there again. A great place to stay and see all of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Hesitate For One Moment....The Best Hotel Experience on Our Whole Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sophia627
Reviews.Content: We just completed a whirlwind 2 week tour of Italy from Venice to Florence to Rome to Sorrento. This was far and away the best hotel experience we had in Italy. (or anywhere for that matter) All of the raves about the staff are well deserved. They anticipate your needs and actually go out of their way to help at the mear mention of a difficulty of any sort without even being asked. They do this with grace, tact, and always a smile. Just try getting that kind of service any where else. As if the service alone wasn't a good enough reason to stay at the Hotel Farnese, the location was fantastic. Convenient to all of the sites of Rome and yet you'll feel like you are living in a secluded Roman neighborhood, albeit an upscale one. The room was beautiful, immaculate, spacious, richly decorated and authentically furnished. The bathroom was large and perfectly appointed. Everything about the Hotel Farnese exudes class, charm, warmth, romance, and a truely gracious Roman experience. I could go on and on about it but go and see for yourself. I followed the advice of past guests and boy am I glad I did!!..If I am ever lucky enough to go back to Rome, I would not consider staying anywhere else. Christensen, Orlando, FL, USA

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chinea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nts for part of our honeymoon. Great location, clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Why not? It's a quite neighbourhood hotel with good personable service.”
Reviews.Author: coralina
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 3 night stay at the Hotel Farnese from the 9 through to 12 September 2006. The trip was a belated 70th birthday present for my mother and a treat for my two sisters. In total, there were 4 in our party. Like all reviewers I had researched various hotels on tripadvisor and this being my second visit to the eternal city I knew what type of accommodation I wanted. First, I booked directly with the hotel and got a terrific rate for one triple room and one double room, far less than what was on offer on the internet. Second, good and kind attentive service was important to me in selecting a hotel on this trip. The staff and service provided at the hotel were excellent. The hotel although old and not equipped with room safes, is extremely well maintained, very clean and full of character. It is a small and personable hotel. If you are looking for a new boutique hotel with all "mods" and "cons" but which can be cold and unwelcoming, then look elsewhere. A previous critic mentioned the hard beds! Yes they are firm but that's entirely subjective! I personally like a soft bed but then again my mother and sisters found their beds just perfect. And, the bed sheets were crisp linen sheets! There was ample choice for breakfast(buffet style with fruit, cold meats, cheese, hot croissants, cakes, toast, scrambled egg and bacon etc) and the cappucinos were excellent. I believe the hotel has plans to move the breakfast room located in a basement room up to the rooftop in the near future. There you can see the dome of St. Peter's Basilica. Although the hotel is located right next to the metro stop we walked to the Vatican and mostly got taxis which were quite reasonable for a group of 4. The neighbourhood felt safe at night unlike the Termini area at night where I stayed three years ago which can feel a little bit seedy. The restaurants recommended by the hotel were excellent. I wish we only had more time and yes we would return to the Hotel Farnese again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet base for the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: robbogee
Reviews.Content: Some other reviewers have not been happy with this hotel, but we have just returned from a 5-night stay and found it to be an ideal quiet base away from the hubbub from which to explore the city. The metro station is a two minute walk away and a 1Euro ticket will take you into the heart of the city if you can't manage the 10/15 minute walk along safe leafy streets. OK, the rooms are not palatial, but they are very clean, with traditional furniture, and the bed linen is changed every other day. The sheets are linen, which is stiffer than cotton and may be why a previous reviewer found them "itchy". There is a small terrace on the ground floor where you can have a drink from the small bar, but don't expect too much from the roof terrace which is tiny. The staff were extremely efficient and very friendly and helpful, and gave us suggestions for restaurants, which we enjoyed. The best was the trattoria Ragno D'Oro (Golden Spider) just a ten minute walk away, run by Marco and his sons. Everything revolves around son Fabio who will suggest his recommendations from the kitchen's output that night, although there is also a menu if you insist. Nothing was too much trouble, and if there was a delay in a course appearing he would slip a small plate of pasta onto the table to keep us going. The antics of the staff are sheer restaurant theatre and you will need to book to be certain of a table, such is its popularity with local people. We ate there 3 nights out of our 5 in Rome. We are not easily pleased, but we can certainly recommend Hotel Farnese as a quiet base.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Eldarro
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading rave reviews on this site, and because it was ranked the #4 hotel in Rome on TripAdvisor at the time. I was going to be in Italy with my girlfriend for 10 days, and wanted to spend the last night somewhere special, and this looked like it fit the bill perfectly. It doesn't. This is a clean, nice hotel, with good staff, but the room we stayed in was very small and dark -- a gloomy room that makes you think of rainy Sundays!!! The bathroom was spacious and modern, which was a bonus -- from the look of the floor layout on the fire escape plans, some of the other rooms are larger but have smaller bathrooms (with only showers). The TV was a portable, without any movies or other features, and the communal room on the ground floor was quite small. It's listed as a 4 star hotel, but I think it's no more than an average 3 star. I'd have given the hotel a 3 star review, normally, since, as I said, it's not a BAD hotel, just nothing special. But given some of the other glowing reviews on this site (posted by friends of the owners, mayhaps????), I think it's necessary to balance the scales a bit -- hence the 3 star rating. If you get a good rate, and don't mind being a small room, then it's not a bad hotel and isn't TOO far from the centre. But it's certainly nothing special, and came as quite a letdown for us in the end, based on its high standing on TripAdvisor. For once, the reviews on this site have let us down ...

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: fivetools
Reviews.Content: Location - B Rooms - D Service - B- Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. I have to imagine that you will be able to find not only a better hotel but a much better value. In fact, we stayed at a better hotel very close by for the same rate (Hotel Viale Vaticano - which is better but has its plusand minuses). Location: (B) Extremely close to subway station. Rooms: (D) Beds are horrible and stiff. Sheets are old and itchy. King size bed = two twins pushed together. Rooms looked silly - like a Holiday Inn from the 80's. Does not have a safe in the room. Service: (B) Very bad experience with a restaurant recommendation. The staffer recommended a restaurant that he had "gone to with his family a while back." (I thought he said 2 years ago). I specfically asked him if it was affordable and he said, "Oh yes very affordable." It's one of those restaurants without a menu - and since we had a great experience with one of these in Rome just a few days earlier - we didnt hesitate. Once we got there, my "scam" alert should've went off when we were the only ones in the restaurant. The food was plentiful - but not that great. However, the disappointment didn't settle in until I got the bill for 90 euros and a waiter saying "this doesn't include service."--very classy. The waiter also told me that the restaurant was brand new and just opened 8 weeks ago (not 2 years ago).

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...nothing much too expect”
Reviews.Author: GG_Bti
Reviews.Content: I was on my Honeymoon trip to Rome from July 14 to July 18, 2006 and stayed at this hotel after reading wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor but as per my experience, ...the rooms are tooooo shady....tooo small.......age old furniture....it was in total a pathetic experience. Breakfast is just enough if you wish to fill your tummy...otherwise it sucks too. the only good thing about the hotel is the friendly staff. there is nothing much to look forward to this hotel as it is situated in one corner of Rome and you have to walk like hell to reach the city center. The area it is located in seems to be just ok...no bad experience returning late in the night...but it was eerie. All in all, if on a honeymoon, I would not recommend this hotel ...but for budget conscious hotel, you might stay else there are many better B&B's available. Gaurav

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Perth, WA / Auckland, NZ / Valencia, Spain
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: travla5
Reviews.Content: I booked at Hotel Farnese after reading reviews on trip advisor. My 9 year old daughter and myself had a quick stop over in Rome on our travels and made a last minute booking. I was looking for somewhere with more of a personal atmosphere and wasn't disappointed. Very friendly staff, nice traditional style rooms and modern bathrooms. We walked to all the major sights but there is a metro station 2 minutes walk away as well. I made our booking directly with the hotel through their website, and this option was by far the cheapest. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Discreet Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This upmarket hotel is located in Prati, a beautiful district which is both quiet and clean. Its close vicinty to the Vatican, which is within a comfortable walking distance and its closeness to the Metro stop LePanto (literally just a few steps away) makes it one of the best hotels i've stayed in to discover this eternal city. Service was always excellent, staff very helpful and courteous, rooms very well kept with impeccable attention to detail, breakfast was also praiseworthy. I would greatly recommend this hotel and would definately stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: ohioFindlay
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with exceptional service. Would highly recomend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was wonderful and welcoming especially after my earlier encounter with some italians before reaching the hotel. I took a train to the Termini and the staff at the train station were really unfriendly. So when I reached the hotel, the staff were very nice and since we arrived earlier and our rooms were not ready, the receptionist suggested we visit the St Peter's Catheral and we managed to catch the Pope from his window. It was fabulous. When we went back, they brought all our lugguage up to the room. The standard rooms were a bit small but we had a balcony and the shower area was small but it was clean. They recommended good restaurants too. Overall I would give it 2 thumbs up. The only catch is that you must ask them to advice you which exit you should come up by as I got lost as I came out from the wrong exit.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Farnese
HotelInfo.Address: Via Alessandro Farnese,30 | Prati, 00192 Rome, Italy
